question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to ensure that the generated code is executable for demonstration purposes.
Please help me implement this SVG image using code. Women use red lipstick as a beauty accessory.

checklist.title: Is the core SVG lipstick element properly rendered?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the lipstick shape is accurately rendered with appropriate SVG elements (path, rect, etc.). The lipstick should include both the tube body and the colored tip part. Check if proper dimensions are used for proportionality, and if the overall shape resembles a realistic lipstick. Score 0 if no lipstick is visible, 5 if only a basic shape is implemented, and 10 if the lipstick has detailed components and realistic proportions.

checklist.title: Is the coloring of the lipstick accurate and aesthetically pleasing?
checklist.description: Review the color choices used for the lipstick. The tip should be in an appropriate shade of red that looks like actual lipstick. The tube/case should have appropriate contrasting color (gold, silver, black, etc.). Points are deducted for unrealistic colors (e.g., blue lipstick tip), poor color matching between components, or lack of shading that makes the lipstick look flat. Score 0 if colors are completely inappropriate, 5 for basic coloring, and 10 for realistic lipstick coloring with appropriate shading.

checklist.title: Are proper SVG techniques utilized for visual enhancement?
checklist.description: Check whether the implementation uses appropriate SVG techniques such as gradients, shadows, highlights, or patterns to enhance the realism of the lipstick. Evaluate use of techniques like linear/radial gradients for glossy effects, filter effects for shadows, or path manipulations for precise shapes. Deduct 5 points if no enhancement techniques are used, and 3 points if techniques are used but poorly implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the lipstick positioned effectively with appropriate context elements?
checklist.description: Assess whether the lipstick is presented with appropriate context (e.g., slight tilt to show usage angle, potentially on a surface or with beauty accessories). Check if the positioning creates a coherent image that communicates the lipstick as a beauty accessory. Deduct 5 points if the lipstick is floating without context, and 3 points if positioning is awkward or unrealistic. Full points for thoughtful positioning that enhances the presentation.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common display issues (browser compatibility, scaling/responsive display, etc.) and provides fallback options or appropriate viewBox settings. Code with strong robustness should be able to render consistently across modern browsers and screen sizes, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no considerations for robustness are made, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Animation effects like lipstick application or cap removal 2. Interactive elements that respond to user input 3. Creative presentation elements beyond basic requirements). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements or groups that serve no purpose 2. Excessive detail that impacts performance without visual benefit 3. Unnecessary animations or effects that distract from the main subject. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core subject (lipstick) is obscured by redundant elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review code organization (such as logical grouping of SVG elements), proper naming of groups/elements, and efficient use of SVG features. Deduct 5 points if elements are not properly grouped or named; deduct 5 points if the code contains duplicated patterns that could be optimized; deduct 5 points if the implementation unnecessarily increases file size through inefficient techniques. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (realistic and aesthetically pleasing) 2) Proper proportions and visual balance 3) Professional finish with attention to detail. Deduct 3 points for each unrealistic proportion, 5 points for jarring color combinations, and 5 points for poor visual balance. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the implementation complete and suitable for the described purpose?
checklist.description: Judge whether the final SVG effectively represents a lipstick as a beauty accessory: 1) Clear recognition as lipstick without explanation 2) Visual quality that communicates 'beauty product' rather than just an object 3) Overall impression that aligns with cosmetic industry standards. Deduct 5 points if the lipstick is unrecognizable without context, 3 points if it lacks refinement expected of beauty products, and 5 points if it fails to convey the accessory aspect. The full score is 10 points.
